Reviews.Content: A little palace in Florence       Room with ensuite
Reviews.Author: Magig

Reviews.Content: Fabulous small hotel in a great location I stayed at Hotel Cestelli for 4 nights in October 2008. I had a single room with shared bath. The hotel decor is beautiful and Alessio and Assumi are wonderful hosts. My room, the shared bath, and the common area were all impeccably clean. What I most liked was the location, which is in the heart of the historic old city of Florence. I would definitely stay there again the next time I visit Florence.I don't know about the other rooms in the hotel, but I did get a bit of street noise and I recommend you bring earplugs - they worked perfectly for me. Florence is a hectic, vibrant city and noise is to be expected. I didn't hear any noise from the other rooms. Also, as others have posted, there are no televisions in the rooms (which is a big plus for me). There are also no telephones but it was no problem to use the public phones in the nearby Piazza della Republica.Alessio's restaurant recommendations were brilliant - some of the best food I have had.
Reviews.Author: SteveInLA

Reviews.Content: Best value in Florence Our family of three, including 5-year old daughter, sought out the Cestelli after reading reviews here and on Venere.com. We were not disappointed -- the hotel is superbly kept, has very friendly and helpful hosts, and is as centrally located as possible. Alessio and Asumi go out of their way to make sure guests are comfortable and have the information they need for a great stay in Florence. I was particularly impressed that they made reservations for us at the Uffizi and Accademia before our arrival (at our inquiry), and that they provided us with an English language publication with local event schedules and current info and another kids publication which was fun for our daughter. We had a room with a shared bath, but even though the hotel was fully booked we never had a conflict with another guest. Although located in the middle of a very busy city, the Cestelli is on an extremely quiet narrow street, an oasis of calm before confronting the sea of humanity on the Ponte Vecchio or in any of the major piazzas, shopping streets, or tourist destinations. Great recommendations on dining locations too. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: buttercup63

Reviews.Content: Very good, but beware of insects The stay at the hotel was very pleasant, the room that we stayed in was very homely and the shared bathroom was always clean. We visited Florence during the end of summer where temperatures get up to 34 degrees. In agreement with previous reviews it does get very warm in the room and during the night time can get really stuffy, When this happened we opened our windows to let some cool breeze in, but because the hotel is located close to the canal (which is very beautiful) can attract mosquitoes into the room. Alessio and Asumi were very helpful and assisted us with some insect repellent for our following night once we noticed all our bites. If you plan on staying at this hotel, its definitely worth staying at however be aware to bring some insect repellent/spray.
Reviews.Author: AlbertandJudy

Reviews.Content: Hotel Cestelli This place is great value. It is in a fantastic location, right near the river.The place has a unique feel, slightly Zen, with incense burning. The couple who own the place, Alessio and Asumi, were very welcoming and were extremely helpful, they gave us recommendations on where to eat, the best gelato places, and the cheaper places to do our food shopping. Alessio also recommended some landmarks to visit, which we probably would not have bothered with had he not suggested them, but his recommendations were spot on! The rooms are clean, the bathrooms are not tiny and cramped (like you find in many places in Europe!). Only downside was there was no airconditioning in the bedrooms, only a fan, and it gets extremely hot and humid in Florence, so can make it uncomfortable on the hotter days. But other than that, this place is fantastic, I would definitely stay here again!
Reviews.Author: mizcoco88

Reviews.Content: Recommended We stayed 2 nights in Florence at Hotel Cestelli. We loved the character of the old building and the room was spacious, clean and cool. Allessio and Asumi are really helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome and looked after and gave us loads of advice on where to go.The location is ideal for sightseeing; a few minutes walk to ponte vecchio and the river and the sightseeing bus stop is just a minutes walk away. It's a perfect base for a sightseeing weekend and at a reasonable price for Florence.
Reviews.Author: nicola640

Reviews.Content: Location is Perfect       Unassuming entrance to Hotel Cestelli
Reviews.Author: nataliegoestojapan

Reviews.Content: Homely Stayed for three hot summer nights in July 2008. Me and my wife stayed in Room 4, a very clean, nicely decorated room with private bathroom.*Positives*Fantastically friendly atmosphere. The owners really made us feel most welcome and had great recommendations for nearby restaurants and sights. Follow Alessio's recommendations: He doesn't miss.Spotlessly clean rooms in a very old building (medieval Florence).Central location with everything within walking distance.Very sound proof new windows facing the street. When closed, the room was absolutely quiet.*Could be better*No aircondition. 脥n the very hot florentine summer nights it is impossible to sleep without the windows open. The noise from the street and the mosquitoes gave us a very broken sleep.This is probably no problem during cooler spring and fall where you can close the windows.*Overall*Loved the place and would definitely return if an aircondition is installed or if we return in a cooler period of the year.
Reviews.Author: Raunso

Reviews.Content: Way too noisy, no sleep for 3 nights! We recently had a terrible stay at the Hotel Cestelli (it really is not a hotel, more like a pensione), and would not stay there again. The owners Allesio and Asumi are friendly and helpful with dining recommendations. The hotel is clean and is very centrally located. These positives did not make up for the fact that the hotel is VERY NOISY. Because there is no air conditioning we had to leave the windows open at night. It was so loud that no one slept for 3 nights. I know that this is a city and it is noisy, but the hotel's location on a tiny street seemed to amplify every scooter, bus, garbage truck substantially. Ear plugs were not help. Also we had no hot water for showers. There is also a strange system in that once all night keys have been given out they turn off the door bell. We wondered what would have happened if we had lost our keys, it was 2 am and we could not find a phone. We would have had to sleep on the street or the train station.
Reviews.Author: norcalheidi

Reviews.Content: Would probably return       Evening visitor
Reviews.Author: tigerfire

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Place Cestelli was a wonderfoul place for us. Me and my wife were there for 2 nights, in a room with private bath. The rooms are clean. The bathroom 铆s good.The owners, Alessio and Asumi, were very nice with us. They gave us good informations about the city.Cestelli is very well localizated near Piazza Signoria.Firenze and Cestelli were an unforgetble experience.Thank you Alessio and Asumi..
Reviews.Author: caninde2000

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel I stayed at the Hotel Cestelli with a friend in May 2007. It's is a beautiful, and unique hotel. It was so charming. The couple who own the hotel were very nice, and super helpful. They gave us directions, restaurant suggestions, and explained the best way for us to take a day trip to Sienna. It's a very small hotel and each room is decorated differently and filled with beautiful antique furniture. We stayed in two different rooms due to availability, but it was great because we got to see two of the rooms. There are no televisions, phones, or wireless internet; which was nice for us, but I know others must have them. We found internet cafes that had phone use all over Florence though. The first room we stayed in had a small bathroom within the room that had a shower. The second room had a sink in the bedroom, and a shared bathroom in the hallway. I wouldn't be hesitent about using the shared bathroom at all. It was kept absolutely immaculate! Because only a few rooms share the bathroom we never had to wait to access it, it was always open.I loved this hotel!
Reviews.Author: AlaskaEmily

Reviews.Content: Best Hotel of Our Trip! This was by far the best hotel of our trip. The owners, Alesseo and Assumi, were so helpful and wonderful. They treated you like you were at home. They took the time to add extra touches we never thought of - leaving us a welcome note and congrats on our honeymoon, giving us a bottle of champagne when we got there, leaving chocolates there every day, making tour and restaurant reservations and recommendations...the list just goes on. They were great. Location was fantastic. Very nice clean and homey rooms.Couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in Florence!
Reviews.Author: lwelch80

Reviews.Content: A very special place My wife and I first recommended Hotel Cestelli two years ago. We have just returned from our third visit and are just as enthusiastic about this hotel. Alessio and Asumi are still the perfect host and hostess and are as welcoming and helpful as ever. Hotel Cestelli offers a very Italian experience and dare we say it, is quite different from international tourist hotels catering for 鈥渋nternational tourists鈥? Rooms are individually designed and furnished in a simple but very comfortable way. The style is all Italian and is a long way from either cheap international hotel chains (stripped of all character and atmosphere) or the more expensive international chains (offering services and facilities most of us would never need in Florence). If these are the sorts of hotels you long for, perhaps Hotel Cestelli is not for you. For a stay you will recall long after your holiday is over, and which will link you with the history and culture of Italy in a very real way, we believe Hotel Cestelli is a very special place. It reflects the very essence of Florence and is in a very convenient location in the oldest part of the city. It is very close to the Ponte Vecchio, and, indeed, all the important historic buildings. It is also tantalisingly close all the famous fashion houses (Ferragamo is almost next door). The great positives about this hotel for us have been the care, welcome and genuine friendliness of the hosts, the pleasant airy rooms with their very comfortable beds and the relative quietness of the position (always remembering that this is a very busy city!!). The things that are not here and we have never missed are radio, television and bedside telephone! Breakfast is not provided and that is not a problem. Simple Italian breakfasts are available everywhere and for an Italian that means a coffee and maybe a pastry! English and American style breakfasts might be more difficult to find BUT why spoil your lunch 鈥?back to Alessio for his recommended restaurants.
Reviews.Author: Gosman

Reviews.Content: Fantastic Florence We spent 3 days in Florence and stayed at the Hotel Cestelli. The hotel was perfect for our needs. We had a clean well appointed room without too many extras we didn't need, it was very central and within walking distance of everything we needed. It was quiet and the staff were friendly, well informed and helpful. Our every request from chasing up a lost bag to where to eat were dealt with efficiently and knowledgably and we did not get a bad recommendation. It's proximity to everything made our stay so much better as we could see all the sights without wasting time, leaving us with time to sit and watch the city go by. We really enjoyed our stay and would strongly recommend this as a place to stay. We'll be back again if we can.
Reviews.Author: elleandpea

Reviews.Content: Perfect! We stayed in Hotel Cestelli for three nights in August 2007. Although initially we had difficulty locating this hotel we had a superb time and would recommend this hotel to anyone! The owners are very friendly and keep the place spotlessly clean.The hotel itself is fairly basic but it has been nicely renovated and has a perfect location in the heart of Florence - easy walking distance to all attractions! Our room was huge and very reasonably priced at only 70 euros per night! As a negative - the hotel does not provide breakfast and the antique bed was slightly uncomfortable. The hotel has a valet car parking service which is expensive at 20 euros/day.We would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget looking for nice clean accommodation without the extras.
Reviews.Author: eye0ntheprize

Reviews.Content: Warm welcome and great location!       Room 8
Reviews.Author: trav10

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Florence Hotel Cestelli is a great family-run hotel in the heart of Florence - short walking distance to all the sights and galleries! I had a single room with the shared bathroom and it worked out great. The bathroom is kept very clean and was always available. The rooms are also kept very clean. The owners are very friendly and helpful with advice. I would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to others.
Reviews.Author: luvskittles

Reviews.Content: wonderful, charming hosts and economical This was our first stop in Italy in mid October 2007. We stayed for three nights. I had reservations about sharing a bathroom but it was never a problem, freely available, and the bathroom was always spotless. The hotel room was large and unbelievably quiet. The bed was very comfortable. The location was the best and walking distance to everywhere. Very pretty neighborhood. The hosts, Alessio and his wife, were lovely and most accomodating. They spent lots of time guiding us on where to go, how to avoid the mob of tourists, and gave us tips on some of the best restaurants and cafes we dined in while visiting Italy for two weeks. I miss them and the hotel!! I highly recommend this charming hotel!!
Reviews.Author: jk50

Reviews.Content: Hotel Cestelli Is GREAT! My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon in Italy. Hotel Cestelli was our first stop on our two week journey and it was great! The location was great, the atmospere was great but most of all the owners Alessio  Asumi made our stay wonderful with their graciousness and hospitality. They told us of local restaurants and advised us on when to see different sites before the crowds hit town. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel to travelers headed to Florence.
Reviews.Author: rmh1350

Reviews.Content: Third time in my Firenze home Have just returned from my third time staying at Hotel Cestelli. I took my daughter (her first time in Italy) as a college graduation present. This hotel feels like home to me. Alessio and Asumi are the epitome of charming hospitality, and the hotel is an authentic piece of Florence. For travellers who need a hotel with room service, an elevator, or breakfast included, this is not the place for you. If you are someone who appreciates the experience of feeling part of a foreign city in an intimate setting, I highly recommend Hotel Cestelli.
Reviews.Author: fivedog

Reviews.Content: A wonderful special place This is a special place - perhaps not everyones cup of tea but it was certainly ours. Alessio and Asumi are delightful and helpful hosts. Their Palazzo is a lovely building in a central but quiet location. We stayed in the big room which sleeps 4 at the front of the hotel. Although facing on the street it was not noisy, and although it reached 42 degrees on one day it was not excessively hot in the room despite the absence of air conditioning. The bathroom (this room is ensuite) was tiny but had the novelty of being sudpended above an alley at the side of the hotel! Like having a bathroom in the brdge of sighs! The kids thought it was fantastic. Really a great place.
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker

Reviews.Content: Genuine Florentine Experience for people with an average income! I chose Hotel Cestelli (chestelli, by the way) based on Tripadvisor reviews and was very happy to find they were accurate. Alessio and Azumi are wonderful people. The hotel is seconds from everything you want to see and do. The decor is elegant and every detail is thoughtful. It is quiet and peaceful and you are very aware you are in Florence (our room looked onto a courtyard and all we heard were pigeons and lovely music-some rooms look onto the street, but the street is narrow and quiet at night, since it is a side street) . We had room One with a shared bath just outside our door. We had no problem with sharing and the bathroom was always immaculate. You take your key and a night key if you're going to be out past 9 :30pm. It worked every time. Don't worry that the street or area will be seedy due to the extremely great value for money of this hotel. The street and area are beautiful and very, very romantic. We took a walking tour and our street was on the tour!!! Alessio and Azumi spend time acquainting their guests with Florence and help in any way they can. They obviously care that people have a good experience at their hotel. There are rooms of varying sizes. Our room was plenty large enough for two. At one point we had three of our children and a spare parent visiting for the evening! Many good photos are already posted that better show the rooms of this beautiful little hotel. Thank you Alessio and Azumi. We will be back! Betsy and Bodhi
Reviews.Author: Astarte

Reviews.Content: Very personal touch in a touristy town We booked this hotel after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor. While we found the location to be excellent and the hosts Alessio and Azumi to be extremely warm and welcoming, we were not at all thrilled with the room. It was fine and basic. Very clean. Also, very dark- in fact, the entire hotel is very dark because it is on a very narrow old street. Absolutely ZERO view.Alessio is one of the nicest people you will ever meet. We have never been greeted so warmly at any hotel before. He even made our museum reservations for us before we arrived (a MUST during the tourist high season).All in all I would say that this hotel is a really decent value for 95 Euros per night, but not SO charming that I would highly recommend it to others. I wish Trip Advisor allowed for half stars, so that I could give this place a 3.5I would say if you have the $ then spend more for a hotel with a river or hillside view. It's a beautiful city,
Reviews.Author: Carriev

Reviews.Content: A special place in our hearts We stayed at Hotel Cestelli in May 2007 and selected it based on reviews we read on Trip Advisor. com. We could not have been more pleased with our choice! The hotel was everything we could have asked for and more. It is very quaint, charming, tastefully decorated, and in a great location. We stayed in room 2 and were happy with it because it was quiet. The shared bathroom was not problematic or inconvenient for us.Alessio and Asumi (the owners) were so welcoming and really made our stay in Florence special. Alessio even assisted my fiancee in planning our engagement! Hotel Cestelli will always occupy a special place in our hearts and we would definitely stay there again. The 75 euro per night was well worth the location, hospitality, and charm.
Reviews.Author: SYtravels

Reviews.Content: The Human Touch Hotel Cestelli is an excellent family run hotel in central Florence. It is elegantly decorated, reasonably priced and we enjoyed the personal touch of its owners (who welcomed us and gave us excellent advice on restaurants and local wine).I have some brief advice to offer travellers to Florence;1) Florence is flooded by tourists; it was very busy in early June and I would not recommend visiting the city during July and August.2) There are 2 queues for the Duomo, the larger of the 2 leading to the front doors is to enter the Cathedral, the lesser queue on the side of the Cathedral is to ascend to the dome.3) Beware - only change your traveller鈥檚 cheques in banks. I approached a Currency Exchange Bureau in Florence. I enquired what fee they charged for exchanging American Express traveller鈥檚 cheques, they stated that they charged a fixed fee of 3 euros and 90 centimes. I changed 400 euros with them, the cashier then handed me a receipt that betrayed that they had unilaterally applied a 12.5% fee taking a further 50 euros. They intentionally misrepresented their fee; robbery, albeit of a daylight variety.
Reviews.Author: Schenker

Reviews.Content: Mediocre Hotel Cestelli was clean and adequate but no amenities. The location is great and the people who worked there were nice. I wouldn鈥檛 want to stay there if it鈥檚 hot out as you would need to leave your window open (no air conditioning) and the street noise is loud until all hours of the early morning.
Reviews.Author: Pennywise3

Reviews.Content: Not a nice experience for me!!! I did not have a really good experience ring my stay there. It is a rather long walk from the train station considering that you have luggage with you. Small hotel with no facility (i.e. TVs, Radio). I stayed in a room that was close to the road, can be rather noisy at night, Wall of the room is really thin, i can actually hear the next door making out in the middle of the night. Because of above, i really have a problem getting a good night sleep.This hotel is really meant for people who like a old fashion style of living. But they have really nice deco.
Reviews.Author: Brandz

Reviews.Content: Perfect location       The view of Florence from Piazza Michaelangelo
Reviews.Author: orthoarrow

Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a good location       My single room, simple and clean
Reviews.Author: dukektown

Reviews.Content: A Great, Cheap Place to Stay My friend and I stayed here recently based on all the great reviews we read here and we weren't disappointed! The owners were sweethearts and very helpful about which restaurants to go to. The room was spacious and well-designed with high ceilings. We had a shared bathroom but it was always so clean this was never a problem! The location couldn't be better, 2 minutes from the Arno, right on the poshest shopping street, and a 5 minute walk from the Uffizi. There really was no downside, though it was a bit inconvenient that they wanted a casy payment for the rooms (but the price was cheap!). I highly recommend this place!
Reviews.Author: laturista

Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, lovely owners. I recently stayed here with my family and we loved it. Our room was gorgeous and had lovely views from the windows. Alessio and Asumi, the owners, were very friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a wonderful location - near to both the station and the Ponte Vecchio. This probably isn't the best place to stay if modern fixtures such as television and minibars are important to you, but otherwise it's a perfect base from which to explore Florence.
Reviews.Author: Rose888

Reviews.Content: Wonderful place, lovely hosts We stayed at Hotel Cestelli for five days in Room 8, which was tremendously large, sparsely but beautifully decorated and the perfect quiet space to revive in after a long day walking around the city. There really is a homey feel to the place, and everything in the place was immaculately kept up and handled with care. I loved coming back from dinner to find candles lit in the entry hall and bathroom. Alessio and Asumi are gracious, knowledgable hosts who gave us wonderful recommendations about travel, sites and restaurants. I don't think you could find a more wonderful place for such an affordable price. We payed $75 Euros/night and were extremely pleased with our stay.
Reviews.Author: LadyTraveler2007

Reviews.Content: The best vallue hotel in Florence!!! My wife and l just spent several nights at Hotel Cestelli at the end of March and absolutely loved our stay. We have traveled throughout Italy and this was by far our favorite place. From the ambience, energy, decor and most friendly and helpful owners, Alessio and Assumi, we could not have had a more enjoyable stay. The room was perfect, large, extremely clean, the bed was nice and comfortable, plenty of blankets. The hotel has rooms with a private bathroom but we choose to share a bathroom which was fine for us as the bathroom was spotless, freshly tiled floor, clean shower. It was like taking a shower at your friends house, not some bathroom where you wish you brought a pair of flip flops. No one is more fussy, clean-freak than my wife and she was most pleased with it.Hotel Cestelli is a treasure that I am sure the word is spreading. The location is second to none as we were a 5 min walk from the Uffizi and Ponte Vecchio, basically the location is a short walk from most of the major attractions.Allesio, born in Florence and having lived in the US, perfectly fluent in English and his lovely wife, Assumi, an experienced traveler from Japan who also has lived in the US and speaks fluent English loved to share their favorite restaurants and places to go. They even give you a list of their favorite places for breakfast, lunch, dinner and shopping. Did I mention they even called and made reservations for us! Trust me, their restaurant picks are out of this world. We tried several of their picks and they too were probably the best we had in Italy.We could go on and on about Hotel Cestelli and our experience. We are avid world travelers so we definitely know a good place and value when we find it. When we return to Florence, this is our place to stay. Please feel free to contact us with any questions.
Reviews.Author: mallonm

Reviews.Content: Excellent location with personal touch My fiancee and I just returned from a 2 night stay and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location is excellent, down a quiet street, close to the Ponte Vecchio and other well-known sites. The owners were always on hand and full of tips and recommendations which really enhanced our stay. Our room was clean, simple and charming. No TV or phone but in such a beautiful city who cares? The room rates represent fantastic value for the location and friendly service.n.b. It seems we have been there at a similar time to another reviewer who complained about the cold. We didn't feel cold.
Reviews.Author: Boris_Morris

Reviews.Content: Good and Not So Good My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights in Feb. I actually find it difiicult to rate because the good points make for a great review but some other factors let us down.The good points are; the service is excellent. The owners are very keen to help and assist and pointed us in the direction of some fab places to eat. The decor is lovely, very traditional and romantic. The bed is so comfy and the location of this building is excellent.The main let down for me was the temperature of the hotel. I was freezing all the time and reluctant to take a shower because of how cold it was getting out in to the cold. The shower itself was a bit of a let down too. It was a tiny cubicle with a shower curtain which wasn't big enough so left a bit gap for all the cold air to rush in. I even noticed the owners walking round rubbing their arms in the cold but this didn't seem to prompt them to turn the heating up. Also the room had very basic amenities. No phone, no tele, no radio. So unless you take your own equipment the room is deathly silent. Some may enjoy this but I found it uncomfortable and didn't want to spend any time in the room other than for sleeping.Had this room been nice and warm with some kind of entertainment system it would have been geting 5 stars unfortunately I didn't enjoy my stay as much as I could have.
Reviews.Author: Jo'n'Tony

Reviews.Content: Authentic Fiorentine My fiance and I had a wonderful experience at Hotel Cestelli. Promptly greeted by the gracious hosts, we were led to a spotless  gorgeous authentic-style Italian room, with an extremely comfortable king size bed. Tastefully and minimally decorated it enabled us to be captivated by the complex beauty of Firenze (Florence). Hotel Cestelli's simple yet elegant accomodations were remarkable compared to the other one-star hotels we visited during our two month long journey through Europe. Avoiding the tourist traps of restaurants and shops in Firenze was easy due to the great recommendations made by Asumi  Alessio. Florence was one of the highlights of our trip. By day the central location of Cestelli allowed us to navigate the beautiful city and by night the warm feel wrapped us in the comfort of home. We look very forward to returning to this hotel, it comes strongly recommended by us.
Reviews.Author: WorldWideRy

Reviews.Content: Great Place! We, too, like other travellers chose this hotel based on the previous reviews. We were not dissapointed. It was a nice, clean cozy room within walking distance to all the sights. The price, 85 euro a night was also good. Also, be sure to ask the owners for their recomendations. We got great tips on restaurants and a great place to buy wine before we left.
Reviews.Author: goinfastisalive

Reviews.Content: Friendly, but Overpriced We chose this due to the overwhelming positive reviews posted. The hotel is in a convenient part of town, near Ponte Vecchio. As we arrived by taxi and walked up the two flights of stairs, we noticed the moldy smell in the stairwell. The reception area was warm and welcoming with burning incense, and the room was large. However, the bathroom always smelled of mold and a bit of sewer. The heat is turned off in the day, and it is automatic at night. We wished that we had some control of it, as we were quite cold when we returned to the hotel for a brief respite from the museums. There are no phones in the room.Alessio gave us excellent reviews for restaurants which added to our experience. The price of 130 euros a night seemed expensive for this place. I wouldn't necessarily stay here again, as there were many other places in the area as well. The smell and the cold dampered our experience a bit.
Reviews.Author: macron

Reviews.Content: Great Place We have never stayed at a 1 Star Hotel before but due to the great reviews on TA we decided to try this hotel. We were not disappointed, We took a bedroom with a privat bath and we found it to be exceptional. The owners are exceptional in helping and the eating establishments they recommend are outstanding. The location of this hotel is excellent and is easy to find from the train station(walking distance even with lots of luggage) It is very clean and the rooms are great.The only caution is that they do not have A/C which was fine for OCT but for the summer may be a problem. The rooms are also not very sound proofIn summary a great hotel with exceptional hosts. I would recomend this hotel to anyone for the value and for the great accomodation
Reviews.Author: birtleman

Reviews.Content: What a lovely place
Reviews.Author: mrpix

Reviews.Content: Cestelli is a Unique Hotel       Room 5
Reviews.Author: CosmoC

Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel Cestelli We stayed at Hotel Cestelli for 4 nights and really loved it. The location is terrific, the owners are fantastic and friendly, and the room had a wonderful antique look and feel to it. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Author: jsc

Reviews.Content: A Magical Step Back in TIme.... Staying in the Hotel Cestelli is a unique esperience, taking the traveler back in time to a previous era when one stayed in small family style hotels and felt like a person and not a number. This is not an experience for a person who is expecting four star service for two star prices. There is no TV, phone, or other entertainment in your room. Some rooms have baths, others share a spotless large bathroom that is cleaned constantly. Yes, you do hear those motorcycles, but you hear them everywhere in this dynamic town. It quiets down after 11 PM. The owners are personable but not intrusive, and one of them is always there. You hand in your key to one of them when you go out, and they let you in by the buzzer outside and hand you your key when you enter. They live right there in a private area, so you are in a way a guest in their home. This was fine for me as a 72 year old single male, who likes the feeling that if I didn't return someone would come looking for me! The single room was spare, in an old Italian antique fashion, with huge ceiling and sink and bidet. It was abit dark, but one is rarely there except to sleep. It had a unique atmosphere. I enjoyed a number of meals at the excellent restaurant they recommmended nearby at really good prices. I loved the street it was on...very stylish and nice shops and friendly people. The owner got up at 6:15 am to help me into a waiting taxi for the train. All in, I would not hesitate to go back, and probably would pay abit more for a private bath. The personal experience is worth experiencing for travelers looking for more than just impersonal service and predictable rooms. In sum, a rare find.
Reviews.Author: Debussy10

Reviews.Content: Beautiful contemporary "old fashioned" small hotel       Inside our room.
Reviews.Author: blork

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel We were delighted that all reviews for Hotel Cestelli came true and we enjoyed a pleasurable few nights stay there recently. The hotel exudes a sense of calmness and tranquility which we felt was vital after a day of walking/queuing and sightseeing!The owners, a friendly italian/Japanese couple were always willing to share their thoughts on where best to go and steered us in the best direction. We found fabulous places to eat and certainly would not have had they not told us where to go.They also encouraged us to cross the bridge and take a walk that gave us fantastic views of Florence, i highlight of our trip.I would certainly recommend the hotel, our room was huge, sparsly decorated to fab style, we did not have a bathroom so the only inconvenience was passing through the reception area but that was only a minor inconvenience in comparison to the comfort we felt there. Thumbs Up for Hotel Cestelli!
Reviews.Author: Failte2

Reviews.Content: Loved this little gem!       Room #3
Reviews.Author: JennynDerek

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel at a reasonable price       Beds
Reviews.Author: gilbert02

Reviews.Content: Nice place, good deal. The owners were great and really nice. They had great recommendations for restaurants and things to do around the city. I loved the location. Very close to the main attractions, but just far enough away from the crowds. The room was huge, sparsly decorated, but extremely clean. The bathroom was ok. The clingy shower curtain drove me nuts. It would have been ideal if the tub was wider or the shower had a glass door. Overall, it was a still good deal for the price we paid.
Reviews.Author: Marmalaide

Reviews.Content: Wonderful little corner of a wonderful city My partner and I spent five wonderful days in Florence. Our trip was enhanced by the oasis of the Hotel Cesteli. Hosts Alessio and Asumi, are attentive and ever present. They gave great advice to us; we really had done almost no research on what to do while we were in Florence. The hotel is well located, quiet but convenient. My only hesitation was the attentiveness of the hosts; they were almost too attentive. They buzzed us in to the building when we arrived and had our room key for us. When we went out in the evening they asked if we wanted the night key (if we were coming in after 10). I have always preferred smaller hotels, and I don't remember ever receiving such personal service.It was a bit of a bother sharing the bathroom (with 5 or 8 rooms, I think), but there was a sink in our room. Some of the rooms have ensuite baths.
Reviews.Author: gogotom

Reviews.Content: Outstanding This impeccable inn proves the worthlessness of the star rating as we have stayed in many a three- or four-star hotel we liked less well than this very special establishment, which beautifully reflects the cultural and artistic backgrounds of the attentive and genteel proprietors. Meeting this lovely couple not only enhanced our visit to Florence; it stands out as the defining memory of an exquisite trip to Italy.
Reviews.Author: LeahSpencer

Reviews.Content: Interesting stay: good and bad... We had heard the usual good words about this place, and so booked there for a couple of nights. In the end, it was ok, but had some odd elements that will probably keep us from returning. I guess you get what you pay for, which isn't saying the place was bad--for the cost it's probably the best deal in this area of Firenze (Florence?). But this is to say that the place is basically a massive full-floor flat that the owners have apparently divided into an inn. That might be a valid description of many inns, but in this case it resulted in some odd effects.First off, the place occupies the second floor of a tremendous five or six story apartment complex right in the heart of the old town. The building is one of many fine structures sandwiched along a cobbled road near the river that runs through town. And it's in a great location: just far enough from the huge cathedrals and Medici castle so that it's not thronged by the crowds (which never seem to dissipate--said fully aware that we constituted part of that infinite crowd during our stay). But everything in old Florence ends up being about a five or ten-minute walk away, so it's essentially near to everything. It's a fine location.The first oddity is that when you approach the place, you must ring a buzzer to be let in--because, again, this building is a residence in which other people live. Maybe not a big deal. Once you get into the inn, on the second floor, it's striking how beautifully appointed the place is: mild and tasteful medieval decor, with low lighting, and a general atmosphere that itself is almost worth the cost of the room. You'll feel like you're in a tranquil abbey just sitting by the innkeep's desk receiving your key. As every other review here attests, the couple running the place are indeed a fantastic pair: cordial, considerate, and quick to share names of places to eat and stroll. We tried all the eateries they suggested, and they were all fantastic (and all within a ten minute walk). And more: I was trying to find a particular place which neither of them had heard of, but the fellow, un-hesitating, got out a few books and in no time had located the place I was seeking. Again, very good hosts.Our room was massive (can't remember the number of the room). Almost too massive, if that makes sense. It was as if they'd placed a bed in a huge converted dining room; although of course I don't mean to say there was a table and settings; it was just an odd room to be sleeping in, probably not a bedroom in the flat's former incarnation. And here began the sense of being less in an inn, more a guest in someone's large and exquisite home. There was no phone in the room, no bedside clock, no television (and of course many will tsk tsk my mentioning this ommission...but frankly I like having the choice of watching the evening news or not, and don't appreciate inns that make this choice for me); and no air conditioning or fan. This last bit would be fine if you could sleep with the windows open, except that we tried doing this and the screenless windows resulted in a misquito-party buzzing around our ears through the night. The next night we kept the windows closed, and it was a bit tight with no circulation, even in a room so generous. There was a bed, a few chairs, and a wardrobe. It was elegant, and the bed was fine, but the room itself was...uncomfortable. It did, however, have a private bath, with a toilet, sink, full shower, and good supply of hot water.The key situation there is strange. You receive a skeleton key to your room...but you must return the key to the innkeeper whenever you step out. And so when you return to the hotel from wherever you've gone, you must get your key back from the innkeep in order to enter your room. It strikes me as being terribly inconvenient for the innkepper to have to constantly be on alert for guests in need of their keys, or in need of handing-in their keys. Now, the innkeeps were always nearby, and so we didn't have to wait at all for the key: but it was just odd that you continually had to hand the thing in and get it back. And you only receive a key to the building's front door if you're going to be out later than 10pm: before then, you must buzz for entry. Every time. The result is that we found ourselves not returning to the hotel as often as we might have, and staying inside sometimes instead of running down to the cornerstore as we might have, simply because of this odd key situation and the akward sense it imparts of being a bother if you were to need a series of in-and-out jaunts. The whole thing could be remedied by simply giving guests a set of front and room door keys to retain during their stay...as does every other hotel/inn I've ever visited. This place does not. It's an odd practice, and I can only guess it has something to do with the fact the inn is a flat in a residential building.I'm trying to balance a line here. One the one hand, the innkeeps do such a fine job and are so friendly, and their place is indeed stunning, so I don't want to discourage business. However, the things I've mentioned were just enough of a bother to us that I need to mention them, so that others who might find them similary bothersome will be aware. In the end, it's a question of whether the fantastic price for these rooms offsets the oddities. For me, it did not; for you, perhaps it does.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Simply Outstanding! Have just returned from 4 nights at Hotel Cestelli, and am still raving to everyone about this wonderful small hotel. The shared bathroom is a small inconvenience (we didn't hear noise from other rooms, by the way, in room 2, so ask for this room if you worry about that factor) but absolutely overwhelming this negative is the terrific combination of location, convenience, price, and the spectacular hosts, Alessio and Asumi. The location is hard to beat, right by the Arno and the Sta. Spirito Bridge, and adjacent to the most exclusive designer shops while situated in a quiet side street. There is no breakfast served, but wonderful options are a short block away. The price is very low, which always helps. But far and away the shining stars of Hotel Cestelli are Alessio and Asumi. While orienting us to the hotel, Alessio took the time to mark on the map his favorite restaurants all over town and other helpful hints. He made reservations for us every night and helped us in innumerable ways. He and Asumi took the time to chat with us and make sure we were comfortable in every way. One of the most exciting parts of international travel is the human connections you make. Few hoteliers make, or take, the time to really talk to their clients. The personal touch is the thing that sets Hotel Cestelli apart and makes the necessity of sharing a bathroom worth the trouble. I feel like I not only had a pleasant stay, but I left friends behind in Florence. Viva, Hotel Cestelli!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Thin walls and toilet queue We booked this hotel based on a lot of praise in Tripadvisor. We were assured that even though the room didn't have bathroom, this was no queues or problems. We were very friendy received, but after one night we cancelled the rest of our stay. It is annoying that there are five rooms sharing the toilets, and we had to wait several times durings our short stay. And every sound from that very toilet could be heard in our room next to the toilet. We were wakened at nigth with toilet visits. Even though the people were very firendly and the hotel rate was low, I'm sorry to say that this is not a place for us. It is very strange for us that this hotel has so many very good reviews. It may of cource be that our expectations were to high. Reader, be aware that this is a one star hotel with shared toilets and thin walls at least. If you can live with that, the hotel is ok.
Reviews.Author: TorViksjo

Reviews.Content: Great place, Great hosts, Great location We stayed here for two nights at the end of April. The hotel is very comfortable, clean, reasonably priced and it is very difficult to believe it is only a 1-star. Alessio  Asumi made our stay really special. We got engaged while in Tuscany and they gave us champagne and chocolates to celebrate - a really lovely touch. They were excellent in advising us on places to eat, cafes and wine shops. We had a lovely stay here and I would definitely return.
Reviews.Author: DKil

Reviews.Content: Great hosts and location Really enjoyed our 5 nights at the Hotel Cestelli in March. Great hosts, Alessio and Asumi, were always available with help and recommendations. Location beyond sensational. According to the Italian rating system, the hotel only gets one star. Absolutely comparable to some of the 2 and 3 star places we stayed. 5 minutes from Ponte Vecchio, 1/2 block from Ferragamo (as in shoe fame), in a real neighborhood. Two flights up, large room with comfortable private bath. Only suggestion is weights on the shower curtain, which clings to you when the hot water is on (small toiletry bottles will work if placed correctly). This is a classic building, which means slightly noisier plumbing and slightly thinner walls. But street is very quiet, with wonderful local restaurants. We only paid 80 euros for the room with private bath. Definitely would return and recommend to our friends who didn't need frills.
Reviews.Author: Travelfan

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hosts Many reviewers have raved about the Cestelli, and we can only echo their praise. The location is fantastic (2 minutes to the Ponte Vecchio, 2 more to the Uffizi), the rooms are lovely and spacious, and spotlessly clean. But the best part is the hospitality shown by Alessio and Asumi, the charming young owners. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Before we travelled they had helped us with advice, and reserved a slot at the Uffizi for us (a must if you plan to go, because you totally avoid queueing). And then, when we got there and asked about somewhere for lunch, Alessio produced his own personal list of favourites and talked us through it, marking places up on a map, and even making reservations on our behalf. And these were out-of-the-way gems frequented by locals and tourists fortunate enough to have had advice from someone like Alessio. Like another reviewer our favourite was the Osteria Santo Spirito - a wonderful place we'd never have found by ourselves. My ravioli in a cream and lemon zest sauce was delicious, and the 'budino di panna' was to die for.If total tranquility is a must then the hotel is very central and therefore has traffic moving by. The rooms are double-glazed but you can hear some noise. On the other hand there is no noise from other rooms, partly perhaps because the rooms do not have tv's (hurrah). Also, if you are the kind of traveller who wants 5-star luxury, an in-house restaurant, and somewhere with spa facilities, go somewhere else. But if you value friendliness and warmth above formality, this is for you.So thank you Alessio and Asumi, and to the rest of you - look no further!
Reviews.Author: A&A_F-L

Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in location of amazing Florence       Lobby of Hotel Cestelli
Reviews.Author: milica

Reviews.Content: Best Cheap and Charming Hotel in Florence       Room in Hotel Cestelli
Reviews.Author: Blacklisted

Reviews.Content: A Perfect Place to Stay! We stayed here for 8 nights and often spent our evenings sitting in the lobby talking with Alessio and Asumi about politics, restaurants and families. This was truely a home away from home. Alessio is passionate about Florentine culture and food and is an excellent resource for all his guests. Our room was spotless as was the rest of the hotel and sharing a bathroom was fine. The location is a pleasant surprise, close to everything and yet tucked away. This is a find and it looks as if it has been found!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place Hotel Cestelli is absolutely a great place to stay when visiting florence. Rooms were very spacious and decorated with good taste. The owners (Alessio and Asumi) were really nice and helpful, and the location of the hotel could not be better. I recommend this place for everyone.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Best Kept Secret in Florence Our stay at Hotel Cestelli will definitely be the highlight of our trip to Italy. The amazing thing is that of the 3 hotels we stayed in during our 10 days in Italy - Hotel Cestelli was only half the price per night of our other accommodations AND it was the best experience of all.Not only was the hotel quaint, intimate, centrally-located and spotless, but the owners Alessio and Asumi made sure our stay was truly authentic and wonderful. They gave excellent, authentic florentine restaurant recommendations at very fair prices, was always friendly and helpful in helping us plan our day and and in general were just wonderful hosts.We would definitely stay at Hotel Cestelli again. Thanks Alessio  Asumi - we look forward to opening that bottle of wine!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Delightful Hotel We had a delightful 2 night stay at Hotel Cestelli in May 2005. Postives include close proximity to train station and city sights (all within walking distance); incredibly friendly and helpful staff; option to purchase bottles of water; safe neighbourhood; clean and nicely decorated rooms; and the unique, relaxing artistic atmosphere created by candlelight and incense throughout the hallway and reception area. Only negatives were the incredibly small shower and a difficult to use door lock. However the staff and atmosphere made our stay in Florence and we would definitly stay there again.Andrew and BronwynChristchurch
Reviews.Author: andrewspencer
